paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: The main objective of this report is to assess the current school facilities. This report is based on a questionnaire conducted among over 200 students.

paragraphs.label: General View
paragraphs.text: It is generally agreed that the school provides a pleasant learning environment. The classrooms are in good condition and many students referred to the new IT equipment as helpful for lessons. By far the best aspect of the facilities is the sports hall, which is modern and well-equipped.

paragraphs.label: Problems
paragraphs.text: However, one major concern expressed by students is the overcrowded library. By far the worst aspect of the IT facilities is that machines frequently break down. The library is far from ideal since it lacks sufficient seating during exam periods. This is mainly due to the fact that student numbers have increased significantly.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: One key recommendation would be to replace outdated computers with modern equipment. In order to maximize study space, I would strongly recommend adding more library seating. It is essential that the school invests in covered outdoor areas.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: Taking everything into account, it seems clear that these improvements would significantly enhance the learning environment for all students.

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: This report focuses on assessing school facilities and suggesting improvements. The information presented was collected through student surveys.

paragraphs.label: Positive Aspects
paragraphs.text: There is a broad consensus that the school offers a good learning environment. What makes the library so valuable is that it provides a wide selection of resources. One positive aspect of the facilities is the sports hall. The highlight of the school is the recently upgraded IT equipment.

paragraphs.label: Areas for Improvement
paragraphs.text: One major criticism expressed by many students is the overcrowded library during exams. Computer facilities are far from ideal, considering that machines often malfunction. The toilet facilities are outdated. This is mainly because no renovations have been done for over ten years.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: If we were to improve facilities, one key recommendation would be to modernize computer equipment urgently. I would strongly recommend extending library hours and adding more seating. It is essential that toilets are renovated soon.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: The main conclusion to be drawn is that while facilities are adequate, improvements are necessary. To sum up, these changes would benefit all students.

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: The main objective of this report is to assess the two-week exchange programme in Spain and recommend whether it should continue. This report is based on feedback collected from participating students after the visit.

paragraphs.label: Accommodation and School Activities
paragraphs.text: It was generally felt that host families were welcoming and provided comfortable accommodation. Students attended regular lessons, joined group projects and took part in cultural activities. One positive aspect of the programme was the supportive attitude of teachers, who encouraged students to participate actively.

paragraphs.label: What Students Learned
paragraphs.text: What made the experience so valuable is that students had to communicate in Spanish every day in real-life situations. Many participants reported improved confidence, greater independence and a better understanding of Spanish culture. As a result, students became more willing to speak even when they made mistakes.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: I would strongly recommend continuing the exchange programme because the educational benefits are clear. One key recommendation would be to organise more mixed-group activities after school so that visiting students spend more time together.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: Taking everything into account, it seems clear that the programme should be offered again next year as it provides invaluable learning experiences.

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: This report focuses on evaluating the exchange programme in Spain and deciding whether it should be continued. The information presented was collected through questionnaires and discussions with students and teachers.

paragraphs.label: Strengths of the Programme
paragraphs.text: There is broad agreement that accommodation with host families was a major strength, as students felt safe and included in daily routines. School activities were well organised, and one feature that was highly appreciated was project work, which encouraged teamwork and communication. Cultural visits also helped students understand local traditions.

paragraphs.label: Learning Outcomes and Concerns
paragraphs.text: What makes this programme especially effective is that learners practise the language in authentic settings, which improves fluency and listening ability. Many participants also reported increased motivation. However, one major concern expressed by students is that some participants had limited contact with other exchange students after lessons.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: If the programme is continued, one key recommendation would be to introduce regular mixed-group events such as sports sessions or city walks. It is essential that students receive clear guidance on meeting points, transport and emergency contacts.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: To sum up, the programme should continue, as the advantages clearly outweigh the difficulties. The main conclusion to be drawn is that students benefit greatly from this experience.

paragraphs.label: Introduction

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: The main objective of this report is to assess the local sports centre and suggest improvements for young users. This report is based on feedback collected from teenage members and occasional visitors.

paragraphs.label: Current Facilities
paragraphs.text: It is generally agreed that the centre offers a good range of facilities, including a gym, a swimming pool and several courts for team sports. One positive aspect of the centre is the variety of group classes, such as dance fitness and beginner training sessions.

paragraphs.label: Problems
paragraphs.text: However, a common complaint relates to overcrowding after 5 p.m., when many students arrive. As a result, users often have to wait for machines or leave early. By far the worst aspect of the centre is the changing rooms, which are small and outdated. This is mainly due to the fact that the building has not been renovated for several years.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: One key recommendation would be to improve the changing rooms by adding lockers and increasing cleanliness checks. In order to reduce overcrowding, it may be worth considering student-only time slots or extending opening hours on weekdays.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: Taking everything into account, it seems clear that these changes would make the centre more attractive to young people and encourage healthier lifestyles.

paragraphs.label: Introduction

paragraphs.label: Strengths
paragraphs.text: There is broad agreement that the centre provides good value for money and offers modern equipment in the gym area. By far the best aspect of the sports centre is the swimming pool, which is clean, well supervised and suitable for different ability levels. One feature that was highly appreciated was the range of weekly classes available at a reasonable price.

paragraphs.label: Areas for Improvement
paragraphs.text: One major criticism expressed by teenage users concerns overcrowding in the gym during peak hours. The facilities are far from ideal at these times, as it is difficult to access popular machines. In addition, the changing rooms need attention. This is mainly because they are outdated and not designed for the current number of users.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: If the council wishes to improve the service, one key recommendation would be to introduce a booking system for busy hours and provide clearer information about quieter times. I would strongly recommend renovating the changing rooms and adding more lockers.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: To sum up, these changes would significantly improve the experience for young people and increase membership among teenagers.

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: The main objective of this report is to evaluate the recent school trip and suggest improvements for future visits. This report is based on feedback collected from students and accompanying teachers.

paragraphs.label: Accommodation and Activities
paragraphs.text: It was generally felt that the accommodation was comfortable and suitable for a school group. The programme included guided tours, workshops and evening activities. One positive aspect of the trip was the variety of activities, which kept students engaged throughout the stay.

paragraphs.label: Problems and Enjoyment
paragraphs.text: By far the best aspect of the trip was the interactive workshop, which helped students understand the topic more clearly. However, a common complaint relates to the long travel time, which caused tiredness on the first day. As a result, some students found it difficult to concentrate during afternoon activities.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: One key recommendation would be to plan an earlier departure time to reduce fatigue. In order to improve the overall experience, it may be worth considering including more free time in the evening.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: Taking everything into account, it seems clear that the trip was successful but could be improved with better planning and timing.

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: This report focuses on assessing the organisation, accommodation and activities of the recent school trip. The information presented was collected through questionnaires completed by participating students.

paragraphs.label: Strengths of the Trip
paragraphs.text: There is broad agreement that the accommodation met expectations and staff at the venue were helpful. What made the trip particularly successful was that activities were closely linked to subjects studied in class. Many students found the guided tour especially informative.

paragraphs.label: Areas for Improvement
paragraphs.text: One major criticism expressed by students concerns the tight schedule, which allowed little time for rest. This is mainly because too many activities were planned in a short period. Consequently, some students felt exhausted by the end of the trip.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: If similar trips are organised in the future, one key recommendation would be to reduce the number of daily activities. I would strongly recommend including optional evening sessions so students can choose how to spend their time.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: To sum up, better pacing would greatly improve the experience and ensure students benefit fully from future trips.

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: The main objective of this report is to assess current library services and suggest improvements. This report is based on feedback collected from students who regularly use the library.

paragraphs.label: Current Services
paragraphs.text: It is generally agreed that the library provides a quiet and comfortable place for study. It offers a wide range of books, access to computers and space for group work. One positive aspect of the service is the helpful librarian, who supports students with research tasks.

paragraphs.label: Problems
paragraphs.text: However, one major concern expressed by students is the limited number of seats during exam periods. By far the worst aspect of the service is the early closing time, which prevents many students from studying after school. This is mainly due to the fact that there is not enough staff to supervise longer hours.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: One key recommendation would be to extend opening hours twice a week during exam periods. In order to improve study conditions, it may be worth considering adding more desks and chairs.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: Taking everything into account, it seems clear that these changes would benefit a large number of students and improve academic performance.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: To sum up, these changes would significantly enhance the quality of library services and support student learning.

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: The main objective of this report is to evaluate my recent work experience placement and recommend whether it should continue. This report is based on my daily observations and feedback from my supervisor.

paragraphs.label: Company and Tasks
paragraphs.text: The placement took place at a local company where I assisted staff with basic administrative tasks and customer service. It was generally felt that employees were supportive and willing to explain procedures. One positive aspect of the placement was being trusted with real responsibilities.

paragraphs.label: Skills Developed
paragraphs.text: What made the placement so valuable is that I developed communication and teamwork skills in a real working environment. I also learned how to manage my time more effectively. As a result, I became more confident when dealing with unfamiliar tasks.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: I would strongly recommend continuing this placement because it provides practical experience and prepares students for future employment. One key recommendation would be to introduce a wider variety of tasks so students remain motivated.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: Taking everything into account, it seems clear that the placement offers clear benefits and should definitely continue.

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: The main objective of this report is to assess the school cafeteria and suggest improvements. This report is based on feedback collected from students who regularly use the service.

paragraphs.label: Current Services
paragraphs.text: It is generally agreed that the cafeteria offers affordable meals and friendly service. There is a daily hot meal, as well as sandwiches and snacks. One positive aspect of the cafeteria is that it saves students time during the school day.

paragraphs.label: Problems
paragraphs.text: However, one major concern expressed by students is the long queues at lunchtime. By far the worst aspect of the cafeteria is the limited seating, which forces some students to eat quickly or stand. This is mainly due to the fact that several year groups have lunch at the same time.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: One key recommendation would be to introduce staggered lunch times to reduce queues. In order to improve comfort, it may be worth considering adding more tables or using an additional room for seating.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: Taking everything into account, it seems clear that these changes would improve student satisfaction and make lunchtime more enjoyable.

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: This report focuses on evaluating food quality, service efficiency and seating in the school cafeteria. The information presented was collected through questionnaires completed by students from different year groups.

paragraphs.label: Strengths
paragraphs.text: There is broad agreement that the cafeteria provides good value for money and that staff are polite and helpful. What makes the service particularly useful is that students have access to a hot meal every day.

paragraphs.label: Areas for Improvement
paragraphs.text: One major criticism expressed by students relates to the lack of healthy options, such as fresh fruit and salads. The menu is far from ideal for those who want a balanced diet. As a result, many students choose snacks instead of full meals.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: If improvements are to be made, one key recommendation would be to introduce a wider range of healthy options. I would strongly recommend displaying nutritional information to help students make informed choices.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: To sum up, these changes would encourage healthier eating habits and improve overall satisfaction with cafeteria services.

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: The main objective of this report is to evaluate the recent school environmental initiative and recommend whether similar projects should be organised in the future. This report is based on feedback collected from students and teachers involved in the project.

paragraphs.label: Project Activities
paragraphs.text: The initiative included a recycling campaign, a litter-picking day and short presentations during form time. It was generally felt that student participation was high, particularly among younger year groups. One positive aspect of the project was the clear organisation of activities.

paragraphs.label: Achievements and Difficulties
paragraphs.text: By far the best aspect of the initiative was the increased awareness of environmental issues among students. However, one major concern expressed by participants is that some recycling bins were not emptied regularly. As a result, this discouraged students from using them correctly.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: One key recommendation would be to appoint a small eco-team to monitor recycling areas weekly. In order to increase motivation, it may be worth considering organising competitions between classes.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: Taking everything into account, it seems clear that similar projects should be repeated as they raise environmental awareness effectively.

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: This report focuses on assessing the effectiveness of the school environmental project. The information presented was collected through questionnaires completed by participating students and staff.

paragraphs.label: Strengths of the Initiative
paragraphs.text: There is broad agreement that the project successfully raised awareness of environmental responsibility. What made the initiative particularly effective is that activities were practical and easy to join, such as recycling challenges and clean-up events.

paragraphs.label: Challenges
paragraphs.text: One major criticism expressed by students relates to the lack of consistent support from all classes. This is mainly because some teachers were not fully informed about the project aims. Consequently, participation levels varied.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: If similar initiatives are planned, one key recommendation would be to provide clear guidelines for staff before the project begins. I would strongly recommend introducing a short assembly to explain objectives and encourage whole-school involvement.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: To sum up, the project was successful but could be improved with better communication and planning.

paragraphs.label: Introduction

paragraphs.label: Introduction
paragraphs.text: The main objective of this report is to evaluate the summer language course and suggest improvements for future programmes. This report is based on feedback collected from students who attended the course.

paragraphs.label: Teaching Methods and Materials
paragraphs.text: The course included daily grammar input, speaking practice and written exercises. It was generally felt that lessons were well structured and teachers were supportive. One positive aspect of the course was the regular use of pair and group work.

paragraphs.label: Effectiveness and Problems
paragraphs.text: What made the course so effective is that students had frequent opportunities to practise speaking. However, a common complaint relates to the course materials, which some students found repetitive. As a result, motivation decreased slightly during the second week.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations
paragraphs.text: One key recommendation would be to introduce more varied materials, such as videos, podcasts and short articles. In order to maintain interest, it may be worth considering including project work and presentations.

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: Taking everything into account, it seems clear that the course was successful but could be improved with more varied content.

paragraphs.label: Recommendations

paragraphs.label: Conclusion
paragraphs.text: To sum up, these changes would significantly improve learning outcomes and student satisfaction.
